snippet: The House voted overwhelmingly on Tuesday to extend a law banning firearms that can pass undetected through X-ray machines, but did not include provisions regulating guns made with 3-D printers.
abstract: House votes to extend a law banning firearms that can pass undetected through airport X-ray machines, but leaves out provisions that law enforcement officials say are necessary to combat the growing threat of guns made with 3-D printers.
lead_paragraph: The House voted overwhelmingly on Tuesday to extend a law banning firearms that can pass undetected through X-ray machines, but did not include provisions regulating guns made with 3-D printers.

headline.main: House Votes to Extend Gun Law Without New Provisions for 3-D Printed Firearms
headline.print_headline: House Votes to Extend Gun Law Without New Provisions for 3-D Printed Firearms
